title: Turning Conversations into Workflows: A Framework to Extract and Evaluate Dialog Workflows for Service AI Agents
author: Prafulla Kumar Choubey (Salesforce AI Research), Xiangyu Peng (Salesforce AI Research), Shilpa Bhagavath (Salesforce AI Research), Caiming Xiong (Salesforce AI Research), Shiva Kumar Pentyala (Salesforce AI Research), Chien-Sheng Wu (Salesforce AI Research), ... , James Glass (MIT)
relevance_why: The proposed framework for workflow extraction and evaluation might provide methodologies applicable to structuring workflows in audio processing tasks, improving interactions in automated music generation.
background: Extracting structured workflows from historical customer-agent conversations to improve automated service responses.
contribution: This paper introduces a two-step framework to automatically extract and evaluate dialog workflows from customer conversations, achieving improved macro accuracy over traditional methods.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods relied heavily on manual efforts, often leading to outdated workflows without systematic extraction techniques.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by utilizing a retrieval process to filter relevant conversations based on procedural elements, combined with a structured question-answer-based prompting approach.

key_innovation: The use of a multi-agent debate approach (QA-CoT) to iteratively refine the workflow based on contextual insights from historical interactions.
real_world_impact: The framework could enhance customer service efficiency by enabling service AI agents to respond more accurately and consistently, potentially improving customer satisfaction.
limitations: The method is primarily designed for service AI agents, which may limit its applicability in more complex domains.

new_terms.QA-CoT: **Question-Answer-based Chain-of-Thought (QA-CoT)** prompting is a method where a Guide agent formulates questions to clarify and refine the contextual understanding of workflows through iterative exchanges.
